=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Alpha House Review Date: 2014/01/05 Categories: Comedy, Drama Product Description: ["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."] Average Rating: 4.3 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Adam Bernstein', 'Michael Mayer', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Bob Balaban', 'Jann Turner', 'Jake Schreier', 'Antoine Douaihy', 'Clark Johnson', 'Michael Pressman'], 'Producers': ['Jonathan Alter']} Review Text: I am impressed with the program and the actors involved. I hope this is not the way Washington really is. However, I suspect that it is.
I look forward to each week's episodes. When I watched the first episode I wasn't sure this program would be cancelled. Now I'm hooked and look forward to each new episode. Review Title: A excellent tv program Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
Grizzly Man Timothy Treadwell (Actor), Werner Herzog (Director) Rated: R Format: DVD Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Lionsgate Home Entertainment, Lionsgate Indie Selects ['In this mesmerizing new film, acclaimed director Werner Herzog explores the life and death of amateur grizzly bear expert and wildlife preservationist Timothy Treadwell, who lived unarmed among grizzlies for 13 summers.'] {'Genre': 'Documentary', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Timothy Treadwell, Werner Herzog', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), Unqualified', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.78:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Audio Description': 'English', 'Item model number': '31398186366', 'Director': 'Werner Herzog', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 43 minutes', 'Release date': 'December 26, 2005', 'Actors': 'Timothy Treadwell', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} I thought I was going to see some really outstanding grizzly filming. This movie should have been labeled "One man's descent into insanity". Timothy Treadwell was a self absorbed,selfish, egocentric man and this story is about him and not the bears. Due to his own behavior he became a dish for one of the bears. Too bad he took someone else along with him to his death. A couple of the bears he "loved" so much had to be murdered because of his behavior. I would not recommend this movie. Conservationist? Who? Timothy Treadwell? The Way Emilio Estevez (Actor, Director), Martin Sheen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Movies & TV, Independently Distributed, Drama ['"The Way" is a powerful and inspirational story about family, friends, and the challenges we face while navigating this ever-changing and complicated world. Martin Sheen plays Tom, who comes to St. Jean Pied de Port, France to collect the remains of his adult son , killed in the Pyrenees in a storm while walking the Camino de Santiago,. Rather than return home, Tom decides to embark on the historical pilgrimage to honor his son\'s desire to finish the journey. What Tom doesn\'t plan on is the profound impact the journey will have on him. From the unexpected and, oftentimes, amusing experiences along "The Way," Tom begins to learn what it means to be a citizen of the world again. Through his unresolved relationship with his son, he discovers the difference between "the life we live and the life we choose."'] {'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Emilio Estevez, Martin Sheen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 1 minute', 'Studio': 'Arc Entertainment', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '5.4 x 0.6 x 7.5 inches; 2.4 Ounces', 'Director': 'Emilio Estevez', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 1 minute', 'Release date': 'February 21, 2012', 'Actors': 'Emilio Estevez, Martin Sheen', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish', 'Number of discs': '1'} I've added The Way to my list of all time favorite movies. I'm surprised it didn't do better at the box office. Excellent and thoughtful movie Alpha House Comedy, Drama ["An Amazon Original series: They work in the Senate. They live in the house - Alpha House. Created by Garry Trudeau (Doonesbury, Tanner '88)."] {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Deutsch'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Deutsch'], 'Directors': ['Adam Bernstein', 'Michael Mayer', 'Andrew McCarthy', 'Bob Balaban', 'Jann Turner', 'Jake Schreier', 'Antoine Douaihy', 'Clark Johnson', 'Michael Pressman'], 'Producers': ['Jonathan Alter']} I am impressed with the program and the actors involved. I hope this is not the way Washington really is. However, I suspect that it is.
I look forward to each week's episodes. When I watched the first episode I wasn't sure this program would be cancelled. Now I'm hooked and look forward to each new episode. A excellent tv program
profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

- **Content Preference:** The user enjoys documentaries focusing on complex human narratives intertwined with nature, and is also drawn to thought-provoking dramas exploring personal journeys and existential themes. They have recently shown an interest in character-driven comedies that may blend humor with social commentary.
- **Critique Style:** They value objective storytelling and critical representation of subjects, expressing disappointment when personal issues overshadow broader thematic elements. They prefer films that prioritize fact and educational content over sensationalism.
- **Cultural Critique:** Exhibits skepticism toward certain portrayals of conservationists, identifying egocentrism as a flaw in character narratives, preferring narratives that harmonize personal stories with larger environmental themes.
- **Viewing Expectations:** Anticipates high-quality cinematography and insightful commentary, feeling let down by films that deviate to psychological or sensational narratives without proper context.
- **Recommendation Stance:** Willing to express strong negative feedback for content that fails to meet expectations, demonstrating a propensity for forthright critiques based on individual viewing experiences.
- **Recent Behavior:** The user has developed an appreciation for comedies that retain depth and social relevance, appreciating strong character development and narrative engagement. This suggests a growing interest in diverse genres that balance humor with thoughtful storytelling.

Overall, the user values authenticity and thoughtful representation in both documentary and dramatic filmmaking, while critiquing works that favor sensationalism or misrepresentation of their subjects.
